I propose placing related inputs close to each other. You can extend 
the s=
pace to 3D and place the actions behind the cards. 
In fact, everything is =
geometrically related. If it is not, HyperNEAT 
is still able to handle thi=
s, but more difficult, I guess. You should 
try regular NEAT first. 

--- I=
n neat@yahoogroups.com, "Thomas Johnson" <thomas.j.johnson@...> 
wrote:
>
>=
 HyperNEAT folks,
> 
> What's the recommended strategy for handling inputs =
that represent 
concepts
> that are not geometrically related? For instance=
, consider something 
like a
> poker game where we want to input both playe=
rs' actions and the cards 
we
> see. We might be able to come up with geome=
tric encodings for either 
of
> these individually, but there's no obvious =
spacial relationship 
between
> cards and actions.
>
